response: Informed consent must be obtained from all participants before medical treatment or research. They should understand the purpose, risks, and benefits of the procedure.
Patient data must remain confidential and secure. Only authorized personnel should access personal medical information.
Non-maleficence requires avoiding unnecessary harm. Consider potential harms and benefits before proceeding with treatment.
Beneficence obligates professionals to act in the patient's best interest and promote their well-being.
Respect for autonomy means patients have the right to make decisions about their own health care.
Justice requires that health resources are distributed fairly and without discrimination.
